headline.main: In Wisconsin, Easing of Laws Leads to Open Use

docs.abstract: Decriminalization of marijuana has resulted in attitudinal change; finds those who smoke are more open and comfortable about it, but that sentiments against its use still remain (M)

byline.original: By PAUL DELANEY Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: MIDDLETON, Wis., May 16 The debate over decriminalization of marijua na in this town of 12,000 people officially ended some time ago, but feelings on the subject still run deep.
docs.snippet: MIDDLETON, Wis., May 16 The debate over decriminalization of marijua  na in this town of 12,000 people officially ended some time ago, but feelings on the subject still run deep.
